title: What are the differences between <ul>, <ol>, and <li>?
content: Explain the purpose of unordered and ordered lists in HTML.
sampleAnswers: <ul> is an unordered list with bullets, <ol> is an ordered list with numbers, and <li> represents each list item inside them.

title: What are semantic tags and why are they important?
content: Give examples of semantic tags and explain their role.
sampleAnswers: Semantic tags like <header>, <footer>, <main>, <article>, and <section> give meaning to the content, improving accessibility, SEO, and code readability.

title: How do you embed a video in HTML?
content: Provide an example of embedding a video with controls.
sampleAnswers:
<video controls>
  <source src="video.mp4" type="video/mp4">
  Your browser does not support the video tag.
</video>

title: Explain the use of <canvas> in HTML5.
content: What is the <canvas> element used for?
sampleAnswers: <canvas> is used to draw graphics via JavaScript, allowing dynamic rendering of shapes, charts, animations, and games directly in the browser.

title: How do you create a table in HTML?
content: List the main tags used in HTML tables.
sampleAnswers: <table> defines a table, <tr> defines a table row, <th> defines a table header cell, and <td> defines a table data cell.

title: Explain the use of <iframe> in HTML.
content: How do you embed external content using <iframe>?
sampleAnswers: <iframe src="https://example.com" width="600" height="400" title="Example"></iframe> embeds an external webpage or media inside the current page.

title: What are the differences between local and global anchors in HTML?
sampleAnswers: A local anchor links to an element on the same page using <a href="#section1">, while a global hyperlink links to a different page or site using <a href="https://example.com">.

title: What is the role of the <meta> tag?
content: Explain at least two uses of meta tags in HTML.
sampleAnswers: <meta charset="UTF-8"> sets character encoding, <meta name="description" content="..."> provides page description for SEO, and <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0"> helps with responsive design.

title: How do you make a form accessible?
content: Name at least three practices for making forms accessible.
sampleAnswers: Use <label> for every input, associate inputs with id, provide aria-* attributes when needed, ensure proper tab order, and add clear error messages.

title: What is the difference between <section> and <div>?
content: Explain when to use semantic <section> vs generic <div>.
sampleAnswers: <section> is semantic and should represent a standalone section of content with a heading, while <div> is generic and used only for layout or grouping.

title: Explain the difference between the <b> and <strong> tags.
content: When should you use <strong> instead of <b>?
sampleAnswers: <b> applies only visual bold styling, while <strong> adds semantic importance for accessibility and SEO.

title: What is the difference between <input type="text"> and <textarea>?
content: Explain the differences in usage between single-line and multi-line text input.
sampleAnswers: <input type="text"> is for single-line text, <textarea> allows multi-line text input with resizable area.

title: What is the difference between <script> in head and body?
content: Explain how script placement affects loading and rendering.
sampleAnswers: Scripts in the <head> block rendering unless marked async/defer, while scripts at the end of <body> load after content is parsed, improving perceived performance.

title: Explain the use of the <link> tag.
content: Provide at least two uses of <link> in HTML.
sampleAnswers: <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css"> links a CSS file, <link rel="icon" href="favicon.ico"> sets the page icon.

title: What is the difference between <audio controls> and <audio autoplay>?
content: Explain how attributes affect audio playback in HTML.
sampleAnswers: <audio controls> shows playback controls and waits for user interaction, <audio autoplay> starts playing automatically when the page loads.
